name: configuring
content:

Add to word list
present participle of
configure
to arrange something or put its parts together in a particular form or arrangement: Online buyers can build their own version of the car: many of the company's customers configure their own vehicles. The marines used specially configured submarines.
computing
  specialized to arrange or make changes to a computer system, a piece of computer equipment or software, etc. to make it able to do a particular task or work in a particular way: It used to take days to install and configure a server, and now it can be done in minutes. Check that the device is present on the system and is configured correctly. After I configured my laptop to start up from the CD-ROM drive rather than the hard drive, the installation went smoothly.
